Text: United States v. Hamilton, 3 U.S. 17 (1795) , was a United States Supreme Court case in which a defendant committed on a charge of treason was released on bail, despite having been imprisoned upon a warrant of committal by a district court judge.

<Text: United States v. Hamilton:  Ordinarily, habeas corpus was used to release prisoners held by the judgment of the executive, but not for those who commitment had been authorized by a court order.>

<Text: United States v. Hamilton:  The Supreme Court set bail, but without addressing either attorney's arguments.>
